nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,10 +21,15 @@
Notable changes in 2.5.0
    +
  • When RebalanceProtocol#COOPERATIVE is used, Consumer#poll can still return data + while it is in the middle of a rebalance for those partitions still owned by the consumer; in addition + Consumer#commitSync now may throw a non-fatal RebalanceInProgressException to notify + users of such an event, in order to distinguish from the fatal CommitFailuedException and allow

nodes.bodyText: Should we move this to the Streams upgrade guide?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,10 +21,15 @@
Notable changes in 2.5.0
    +
  • When RebalanceProtocol#COOPERATIVE is used, Consumer#poll can still return data + while it is in the middle of a rebalance for those partitions still owned by the consumer; in addition + Consumer#commitSync now may throw a non-fatal RebalanceInProgressException to notify + users of such an event, in order to distinguish from the fatal CommitFailuedException and allow + users to complete the ongoing rebalance and then reconsider committing offsets.
  • For improved resiliency in typical network environments, the default value of zookeeper.session.timeout.ms has been increased from 6s to 18s and replica.lag.time.max.ms from 10s to 30s.
    • -
  • New DSL operator cogroup() has been added for aggregating multiple streams together at once
    • +
  • New DSL operator cogroup() has been added for aggregating multiple streams together at once.

nodes.bodyText: In Streams own upgrade guide we have a more detailed paragraph for this too: We add a new cogroup() operator (via KIP-150>) that allows to aggregate multiple streams in a single operation. Cogrouped streams can also be windowed before they are aggregated. We refer to the developer guide for more details.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,10 +21,15 @@
Notable changes in 2.5.0
    +
  • When RebalanceProtocol#COOPERATIVE is used, Consumer#poll can still return data + while it is in the middle of a rebalance for those partitions still owned by the consumer; in addition + Consumer#commitSync now may throw a non-fatal RebalanceInProgressException to notify + users of such an event, in order to distinguish from the fatal CommitFailuedException and allow + users to complete the ongoing rebalance and then reconsider committing offsets.
  • For improved resiliency in typical network environments, the default value of zookeeper.session.timeout.ms has been increased from 6s to 18s and replica.lag.time.max.ms from 10s to 30s.
    • -
  • New DSL operator cogroup() has been added for aggregating multiple streams together at once
    • +
  • New DSL operator cogroup() has been added for aggregating multiple streams together at once.

nodes.bodyText: This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters Suggested change users to complete the ongoing rebalance and then reconsider committing offsets. users to complete the ongoing rebalance and then reattempt committing offsets for those still-owned partitions. This one is just a proposal, feel free to take it or leave it. We could also maybe link to the new Javadocs for more details, "just in case" users don't read all the docs/changes carefully before jumping on this
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -21,10 +21,15 @@
Notable changes in 2.5.0
    +
  • When RebalanceProtocol#COOPERATIVE is used, Consumer#poll can still return data + while it is in the middle of a rebalance for those partitions still owned by the consumer; in addition + Consumer#commitSync now may throw a non-fatal RebalanceInProgressException to notify + users of such an event, in order to distinguish from the fatal CommitFailuedException and allow + users to complete the ongoing rebalance and then reconsider committing offsets.
